explanation: ssize_t — The function uses ssize_t for the length parameter and does arithmetic/casts with it. ssize_t is POSIX (not ISO C); you must inspect its typedef/definition to determine whether its presence is a compiler/OS extension in this project. size_t — Used for data_length and arithmetic. Confirming its definition ensures no non‑standard typedef or macro is being used. malloc — The function calls malloc; you must see its prototype/definition to rule out implicit declaration or a project/compiler specific macro/attribute (e.g. __attribute__ or macro wrappers) that would be a language extension. NULL — Used in the NULL check; verify its definition (macro/enum) to ensure it is the standard definition and not a non‑standard extension. WS_FIN, WS_OPCODE_TEXT_FRAME, WS_OPCODE_CON_CLOSE_FRAME — These macros/constants are used in bitwise expressions and comparisons. Inspecting their definitions is required to ensure they are plain integer macros (not defined using compiler extensions such as GCC binary literals, attributes, or non‑standard token pasting) that could constitute language extensions.
